verses.text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”

Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.

For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening, he shall have whatever he says.
But he who doubts is condemned if he eats, because it isn’ t of faith; and whatever is not of faith is sin.
But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.

He said to them, “Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.
Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “ I believe. Help my unbelief!”

Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table; and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn’ t believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
Yet, looking to the promise of God, he didn’ t waver through unbelief, but grew strong through faith, giving glory to God,
True; by their unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by your faith. Don’ t be conceited, but fear;
let’s hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.
He recognized it, and said, “ It is my son’s tunic. An evil animal has devoured him. Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces.”
Your life will hang in doubt before you. You will be afraid night and day, and will have no assurance of your life.
“No doubt, but you are the people,

because an excellent spirit, knowledge, understanding, interpreting of dreams, showing of dark sentences, and dissolving of doubts were found in the same Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar. Now let Daniel be called, and he will show the interpretation.”

But I have heard of you, that you can give interpretations and dissolve doubts. Now if you can read the writing and make known to me its interpretation, you shall be clothed with purple, and have a chain of gold around your neck, and shall be the third ruler in the kingdom.”
When they saw him, they bowed down to him; but some doubted.
He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this proverb, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’”
He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
But arise, get down, and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”
When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “ No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped from the sea, yet Justice has not allowed to live.”
It is doubtless not profitable for me to boast, but I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
I desire therefore that the men in every place pray, lifting up holy hands without anger and doubting.
He didn’ t do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
He marveled because of their unbelief.
Every meal offering, mixed with oil or dry, belongs to all the sons of Aaron, one as well as another.
The wilderness and the dry land will be glad.
He will stretch out his hand against the north, destroy Assyria, and will make Nineveh a desolation, as dry as the wilderness.
The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’
who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with venomous snakes and scorpions, and thirsty ground where there was no water; who poured water for you out of the rock of flint;
honey, butter, sheep, and cheese of the herd, for David and for the people who were with him to eat; for they said, “ The people are hungry, weary, and thirsty in the wilderness.”
They didn’t thirst when he led them through the deserts.
They arose, and went to Ziph before Saul; but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of the desert.
Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah, which is before the desert, by the way. But David stayed in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way.
For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches.
While he was still talking with them, behold, the messenger came down to him. Then he said, “ Behold, this evil is from the LORD. Why should I wait for the LORD any longer?”

The men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph’s house; and they said, “ Because of the money that was returned in our sacks the first time, we’re brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, attack us, and seize us as slaves, along with our donkeys.”
David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the woods.
Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told, he went down to the rock, and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard that, he pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.
Then Saul arose and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
God said, “ Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear;” and it was so.
God called the dry land “earth”, and the gathering together of the waters he called “ seas”. God saw that it was good.
All on the dry land, in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, died.

In the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

It will happen, if they will not believe even these two signs or listen to your voice, that you shall take of the water of the river, and pour it on the dry land. The water which you take out of the river will become blood on the dry land.”

Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
The children of Israel went into the middle of the sea on the dry ground; and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.

Is anything too hard for the LORD? At the set time I will return to you, when the season comes around, and Sarah will have a son.”
The LORD went his way as soon as he had finished communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.
So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba. Abraham lived at Beersheba.
The LORD said to Jacob, “ Return to the land of your fathers, and to your relatives, and I will be with you.”
I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise, get out from this land, and return to the land of your birth.’”
Early in the morning, Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them. Laban departed and returned to his place.
The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “ We came to your brother Esau. He is coming to meet you, and four hundred men are with him.”
Jacob said, “God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD, who said to me, ‘Return to your country, and to your relatives, and I will do you good,’

“ If your people go out to battle against their enemy, by whatever way you shall send them, and they pray to the LORD toward the city which you have chosen, and toward the house which I have built for your name,

toward her young one who comes out from between her feet, and toward her children whom she bears; for she will eat them secretly for lack of all things in the siege and in the distress with which your enemy will distress you in your gates.
For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away unharmed? Therefore may the LORD reward you good for that which you have done to me today.
But if you will go, take action, and be strong for the battle. God will overthrow you before the enemy; for God has power to help, and to overthrow.”
Under their hand was an army, three hundred seven thousand five hundred, who made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
The great dragon was thrown down, the old serpent, he who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world. He was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.
He seized the dragon, the old serpent, who is the devil and Satan, who deceives the whole inhabited earth,
If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
for they are spirits of demons, performing signs, which go out to the kings of the whole inhabited earth, to gather them together for the war of that great day of God the Almighty.

A certain man drew his bow at random, and struck the king of Israel between the joints of the armor. Therefore he said to the driver of his chariot, “ Turn around, and carry me out of the battle, for I am severely wounded.”
Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings had come up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all who were able to put on armor, young and old, and stood on the border.

and divide the plunder into two parts: between the men skilled in war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.

but your servants will pass over, every man who is armed for war, before the LORD to battle, as my lord says.”
About forty thousand men, ready and armed for war, passed over before the LORD to battle, to the plains of Jericho.
that we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.”

David rose up early in the morning and left the sheep with a keeper, and took the provisions and went, as Jesse had commanded him. He came to the place of the wagons as the army which was going out to the fight shouted for the battle.

Saul said to David, “ Behold, my elder daughter Merab. I will give her to you as wife. Only be valiant for me, and fight the LORD’s battles.” For Saul said, “Don’t let my hand be on him, but let the hand of the Philistines be on him.”
Saul’s servants spoke those words in the ears of David. David said, “Does it seem to you a light thing to be the king’s son-in-law, since I am a poor man and little known?”
When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said.
If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can’t be broken),
Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so.
However, if you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, “ You shall love your neighbor as yourself,”
because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my requirements, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.”
The LORD said to Moses, “ How long do you refuse to keep my commandments and my laws?
He was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread, nor drank water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you take away from it, that you may keep the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you.

if you will obey the LORD your God’s voice, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law, if you turn to the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

This book of the law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, that you may observe to do according to all that is written in it; for then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall have good success.
You shall make its lamps seven, and they shall light its lamps to give light to the space in front of it.
“ You shall command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.
the lamp stand also for the light, with its vessels, its lamps, and the oil for the light;
the pure lamp stand, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light,
You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the lamp stand, and light its lamps.
“ Command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
“ They shall take a blue cloth and cover the lamp stand of the light, its lamps, its snuffers, its snuff dishes, and all its oil vessels, with which they minister to it.
“ Speak to Aaron, and tell him, ‘ When you light the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lamp stand.’”
Aaron did so. He lit its lamps to light the area in front of the lamp stand, as the LORD commanded Moses.
For you will light my lamp, LORD.
Your word is a lamp to my feet,

“‘ As for those of you who are left, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf will put them to flight; and they shall flee, as one flees from the sword. They will fall when no one pursues.
The LORD will strike you with consumption, with fever, with inflammation, with fiery heat, with the sword, with blight, and with mildew. They will pursue you until you perish.

if my people who are called by my name will humble themselves, pray, seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
I prayed for this child, and the LORD has given me my petition which I asked of him.
All the people said to Samuel, “ Pray for your servants to the LORD your God, that we not die; for we have added to all our sins this evil, to ask for a king.”
For you, LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, have revealed to your servant, saying, ‘ I will build you a house.’ Therefore your servant has found in his heart to pray this prayer to you.

that your eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward the place of which you have said, ‘ My name shall be there;’ to listen to the prayer which your servant prays toward this place.

It was so, that when Solomon had finished praying all this prayer and supplication to the LORD, he arose from before the LORD’s altar, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread out toward heaven.

The LORD said to him, “ I have heard your prayer and your supplication that you have made before me. I have made this house holy, which you have built, to put my name there forever; and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
The king answered the man of God, “ Now intercede for the favor of the LORD your God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me again.”

It may be the LORD your God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God, and will rebuke the words which the LORD your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.’”

“ Now, my God, let, I beg you, your eyes be open, and let your ears be attentive to the prayer that is made in this place.
Then the LORD appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him, “ I have heard your prayer, and have chosen this place for myself for a house of sacrifice.
Now my eyes will be open and my ears attentive to prayer that is made in this place.
and the judges shall make diligent inquisition; and behold, if the witness is a false witness, and has testified falsely against his brother,

Now give me wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this great people of yours?”

God said to Solomon, “ Because this was in your heart, and you have not asked riches, wealth, honor, or the life of those who hate you, nor yet have you asked for long life; but have asked for wisdom and knowledge for yourself, that you may judge my people, over whom I have made you king,

You, Ezra, according to the wisdom of your God that is in your hand, appoint magistrates and judges who may judge all the people who are beyond the River, who all know the laws of your God; and teach him who doesn’t know them.
Give your servant therefore an understanding heart to judge your people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this great people of yours?”
Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has discernment,

But he who is spiritual discerns all things, and he himself is to be judged by no one.
For if we discerned ourselves, we wouldn’t be judged.
and to another workings of miracles, and to another prophecy, and to another discerning of spirits, to another different kinds of languages, and to another the interpretation of languages.

For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I promised you in marriage to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
If a man has two wives, the one beloved and the other hated, and they have borne him children, both the beloved and the hated, and if the firstborn son is hers who was hated,

then it shall be, in the day that he causes his sons to inherit that which he has, that he may not give the son of the beloved the rights of the firstborn before the son of the hated, who is the firstborn;
So that your beloved may be delivered,
That your beloved may be delivered,
My beloved is to me a sachet of myrrh,
My beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms
Behold, you are beautiful, my beloved, yes, pleasant;
The voice of my beloved!
My beloved is like a roe or a young deer.
My beloved spoke, and said to me,
My beloved is mine, and I am his.
My beloved thrust his hand in through the latch opening.
I rose up to open for my beloved.
I opened to my beloved;
How is your beloved better than another beloved,
My beloved is white and ruddy.
Where has your beloved gone, you fairest among women?
My beloved has gone down to his garden,
I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine.
I am my beloved’s.
Come, my beloved! Let’s go out into the field.
Come away, my beloved!
Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard.
What has my beloved to do in my house,
My soul, wait in silence for God alone,

Now therefore leave me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them, and that I may consume them; and I will make of you a great nation.”
